description:
Also known as a tension test strip, this is a single piece of knitting that includes several tension settings. It’s used to quickly compare fabric feel, drape, and gauge without knitting multiple swatches.

Knit a few rows at one tension, change the tension dial setting, and knit a few more rows—label each section as you go. This quick test helps you choose the best tension for your yarn and project before knitting a full swatch.
tooltip: A test strip with multiple tension settings to compare fabric feel and gauge.
example: Knit 20 rows each at tensions 6, 7, and 8 to decide which setting produces the best fabric.
